pr_title: Move presto verifier doc into README

timeline.author: mosabua
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,51 @@
+Presto Verifier
+===============
+
+The Presto Verifier can be used to test Presto against a database, such
+as MySQL, or to test two Presto clusters against each other. We use it
+to continuously test the master branch against the previous release,
+while developing Presto.
+
+To use the Verifier, create a MySQL database with the following table
+and load it with the queries you would like to run:
+
+``` {.sql}
+CREATE TABLE verifier_queries(
+    id INT NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,
+    suite VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL,
+    name VARCHAR(256),
+    test_catalog VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL,
+    test_schema VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL,
+    test_prequeries TEXT,
+    test_query TEXT NOT NULL,
+    test_postqueries TEXT,
+    test_username VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL default 'verifier-test',
+    test_password VARCHAR(256),
+    control_catalog VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL,
+    control_schema VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL,
+    control_prequeries TEXT,
+    control_query TEXT NOT NULL,
+    control_postqueries TEXT,
+    control_username VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL default 'verifier-test',
+    control_password VARCHAR(256),
+    session_properties_json VARCHAR(2048),
+    PRIMARY KEY (id)
+);
+```
+
+Next, create a properties file to configure the verifier:
+
+``` {.none}
+suite=my_suite
+query-database=jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/my_database?user=my_username&password=my_password
+control.gateway=jdbc:presto://localhost:8080
+test.gateway=jdbc:presto://localhost:8081
+thread-count=1
+```
+
+Lastly, download :maven_download:[verifier]{.title-ref}, rename it to

timeline.bodyText: remove {.none} since that is not supported anyway from what I know

@@ -0,0 +1,51 @@
+Presto Verifier
+===============
+
+The Presto Verifier can be used to test Presto against a database, such
+as MySQL, or to test two Presto clusters against each other. We use it
+to continuously test the master branch against the previous release,
+while developing Presto.
+
+To use the Verifier, create a MySQL database with the following table
+and load it with the queries you would like to run:
+
+``` {.sql}
+CREATE TABLE verifier_queries(
+    id INT NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,
+    suite VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL,
+    name VARCHAR(256),
+    test_catalog VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL,
+    test_schema VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL,
+    test_prequeries TEXT,
+    test_query TEXT NOT NULL,
+    test_postqueries TEXT,
+    test_username VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL default 'verifier-test',
+    test_password VARCHAR(256),
+    control_catalog VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL,
+    control_schema VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL,
+    control_prequeries TEXT,
+    control_query TEXT NOT NULL,
+    control_postqueries TEXT,
+    control_username VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL default 'verifier-test',
+    control_password VARCHAR(256),
+    session_properties_json VARCHAR(2048),
+    PRIMARY KEY (id)
+);
+```
+
+Next, create a properties file to configure the verifier:
+
+``` {.none}
+suite=my_suite
+query-database=jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/my_database?user=my_username&password=my_password
+control.gateway=jdbc:presto://localhost:8080
+test.gateway=jdbc:presto://localhost:8081
+thread-count=1
+```
+
+Lastly, download :maven_download:[verifier]{.title-ref}, rename it to
+`verifier`, make it executable with `chmod +x`, then run it:
+
+``` {.none}

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,53 @@
+Presto Verifier
+===============
+
+The Presto Verifier can be used to test Presto against a database, such
+as MySQL, or to test two Presto clusters against each other. We use it
+to continuously test the master branch against the previous release,
+while developing Presto.
+
+To use the Verifier, create a MySQL database with the following table
+and load it with the queries you would like to run:
+
+```sql
+CREATE TABLE verifier_queries(
+    id INT NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,
+    suite VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL,
+    name VARCHAR(256),
+    test_catalog VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL,
+    test_schema VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL,
+    test_prequeries TEXT,
+    test_query TEXT NOT NULL,
+    test_postqueries TEXT,
+    test_username VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL default 'verifier-test',
+    test_password VARCHAR(256),
+    control_catalog VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL,
+    control_schema VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL,
+    control_prequeries TEXT,
+    control_query TEXT NOT NULL,
+    control_postqueries TEXT,
+    control_username VARCHAR(256) NOT NULL default 'verifier-test',
+    control_password VARCHAR(256),
+    session_properties_json VARCHAR(2048),
+    PRIMARY KEY (id)
+);
+```
+
+Next, create a properties file to configure the verifier:
+
+```
+suite=my_suite
+query-database=jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/my_database?user=my_username&password=my_password
+control.gateway=jdbc:presto://localhost:8080
+test.gateway=jdbc:presto://localhost:8081
+thread-count=1
+```
+
+Lastly, download the [Maven verifier plugin][maven_download], rename it to
+`verifier`, make it executable with `chmod +x`, then run it:
+
+[maven_download]: https://github.com/prestosql/presto/blob/master/presto-docs/src/main/sphinx/installation/verifier.rst#id1

+suite=my_suite

+control.gateway=jdbc:presto://localhost:8080
+test.gateway=jdbc:presto://localhost:8081
